ARTICLE.TITLE: BJP hits out at Congress for ‘sexist remarks’ on FM
ARTICLE.TEXT: NEW DELHI: BJP on Thursday dubbed Congress's comments on finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman as the "worst possible sexist remarks " and sought an apology from the opposition besides asking Sonia Gandhi to explain if she agreed with the remark made by her party about a woman FM."Today, Congress has tweeted about the Niti Aayog meeting with economists and young entrepreneurs headed by the PM. Congress tweeted asking how many men were required to help a woman finance minister. This was the worst possible sexist remark, which is absolutely unacceptable," Union minister Prakash Javadekar said ."Remarks made by Congress shows its sickening mentality. A civilised society will not accept such language," Javadekar said.
